definition: overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: With the waiting depot, the arriving coffin, and the somber faces.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是停柩所，是已運到的棺木，和無數陰沉的臉面。

sentences.english: Has he not a sombre look?
sentences.chinese: 難道他沒有一臉陰沉嗎？

sentences.english: The days were scorching and overcast.
sentences.chinese: 第3天的那一天，天氣是灼熱和陰沉的。

sentences.english: The waiting-room was gloomy, of course, and it smelled badly.
sentences.chinese: 候車室陰沉沉的，那個味兒如一慣地難聞。

sentences.english: The people who lowering , blowsperson cold wind , makes free from likes it.
sentences.chinese: 陰沉沉的，吹者寒風，不受人喜歡。

sentences.english: Rainblood takes place in a dark, rich world.
sentences.chinese: 雨血的故事發生在一個黑暗的，陰沉的世界。

sentences.english: Said the captain; his mood had changed again and the mirthless smile was back on his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他的情緒又變了，脣間又一次泛起了那陰沉的微笑。

sentences.english: "not fine to me, " shouted a large surly woman in the back .
sentences.chinese: “我可不稱心，”背後一個臉色陰沉的胖女人大聲喊。

sentences.english: It was cloudy this morning. But it has now cleared up.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上天氣還陰沉沉的，可現在已經放晴了。

sentences.english: People often feel nore cheerful on a sunny day than on a gloomy one.
sentences.chinese: 晴朗的天氣比陰沉的天氣更易讓人們感覺心情愉快。

sentences.english: The weatherman said it would be clear , but it''s really cloudy.
sentences.chinese: 氣象員說今天是晴天，但天卻陰沉得厲害。

sentences.english: I scowled at his perfect face.
sentences.chinese: 我陰沉着臉，瞪着他完美無瑕的面龐。

sentences.english: And he and his mother stared sullenly at the deer and then walked on.
sentences.chinese: 他和她母親陰沉的看了看鹿也就走了。

sentences.english: The sky was sullen, two parts copper to one of lead, but the scenery majestic.
sentences.chinese: 天空陰沉，一片鉛灰色，但是景色壯觀。

sentences.english: It looks like it’s going to be a dreary day.
sentences.chinese: 看上去一天都會陰沉沉的。

definition: to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
